summary: This document is a December 7, 2007 letter from a law firm to the U.S. Attorney's Office transmitting a signed affirmation of the Non-Prosecution Agreement by Jeffrey Epstein and notifying them of a scheduled plea and sentencing hearing. It includes a request to delay victim notification letters and encloses a court notice for the hearing.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The client who signed the affirmation of the Non-Prosecution Agreement and Addendum dated October 30, 2007. A plea and sentencing hearing is scheduled for him.

persons.name: Sandra McSorley
persons.context: The judge before whom the plea and sentencing hearing for Jeffrey Epstein is scheduled on January 4, 2008.

persons.name: Alex A. Acosta
persons.context: The recipient of the letter at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

persons.name: Kenneth Star
persons.context: Copied on the letter, likely a judge involved in the case.

persons.name: Lilly Ann Sanchez
persons.context: Copied on the letter, likely an attorney associated with the case.

persons.name: Latina Belohlavek
persons.context: An attorney at the State Attorney's Office to whom the Notice of Hearing was furnished by mail.

persons.name: J. A. Oldberoer
persons.context: The attorney from Atterbury, Goldberger & Weiss, P.A. who certified the furnishing of the Notice of Hearing.

connections.description: Acosta is the First Assistant U.S. Attorney to whom the letter regarding Epstein's non-prosecution agreement is addressed.
Judge McSorley is presiding over Epstein's scheduled plea and sentencing hearing.
Belohlavek, from the State Attorney's Office, is notified of the hearing in Epstein's case.

events.title: Signing of Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signs a Non-Prosecution Agreement and Addendum.

events.title: Transmittal of Signed Agreement
events.description: A law firm transmits the signed affirmation of the Non-Prosecution Agreement to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Scheduled Plea and Sentencing Hearing
events.description: A plea and sentencing hearing for Jeffrey Epstein is scheduled before Judge Sandra McSorley.

locations: 500 South Australian Avenue, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
Room 11F, Palm Beach County Courthouse (hearing location)
401 North Dixie Highway, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401 (State Attorney's Office)
250 Australian Avenue South, Suite 1400, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401 (Atterbury, Goldberger & Weiss, P.A.)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein signed an affirmation of a Non-Prosecution Agreement and Addendum dated October 30, 2007.
A plea and sentencing hearing for Epstein was scheduled for January 4, 2008, at 8:30 a.m. before Judge Sandra McSorley.
The defense attorney requested the U.S. Attorney's Office to delay sending victim notification letters to allow for further discussion of their contents.
The document confirms the existence of a non-prosecution agreement in the federal case against Epstein as of late 2007.
The correspondence involves coordination between the defense, the U.S. Attorney's Office (Alex Acosta), and the State Attorney's Office.
